tutorial.moduleOverview: Next.js 14 is the most recent iteration of the acclaimed React framework, bringing revolutionary advancements to web development. This tutorial will guide you through the new features and improvements introduced in Next.js 14.
learningObjectives: Understand the key features of Next.js 14
Learn about the advancements in Server Actions and Partial Prerendering in Next.js 14
Upgrade to or get started with Next.js 14 for enhanced performance and efficiency in web applications
prerequisites: Basic knowledge of React and web development

introduction.heading: Introduction to Next.js 14
introduction.paragraph: Next.js 14 is a cutting-edge React framework that aims to refine the developer experience and boost the efficiency of web applications. It introduces features like Server Actions and Partial Prerendering to enhance performance and streamline development processes.

introduction.heading: Key Features
introduction.paragraph: Next.js 14 includes advancements in Server Actions, Partial Prerendering, and metadata handling. These features redefine the developer landscape and amplify the performance trajectory of web applications.

introduction.heading: Upgrade Information
introduction.paragraph: For users of TypeScript, it is essential to upgrade @types/react and @types/react-dom to their latest versions when transitioning to Next.js 14. The minimum Node.js version has been bumped to 18.17 for this release.
